flawed_nl_solution:
He has 25% of his take-home pay automatically enrolled into his 401k so that's 0.25*1120 = $<<0.25*1120=280>>280
His take-home pay is $1120.00 and $280.00 is taken out for retirement so that leaves 1120-280 = $<<1120-280=840>>840
They also take $100.00 out of his paycheck for taxes so his paycheck will be issued for 840-100 = $<<840-100=742>>742
#### 742

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 740, not 742. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
